author: adityapatwardhan
body:
Get-CimInstance throw a error 'Failed' when trying to query Win32_OperatingSystem. It works fine on Windows 10.

Steps to reproduce
------------------
On a Windows 7 SP1 x64 machine. Install latest PSCore package.
```powershell
Get-CimInstance -ClassName Win32_OperatingSystem
```

Expected behavior
-----------------
Information about the OS
```none

```

Actual behavior
---------------
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12820925/28897264-c4537bc2-7794-11e7-994b-9640e3791642.png)


Environment data
----------------

<!-- provide the output of $PSVersionTable -->

```powershell
> $PSVersionTable
Name                           Value                                                                                   
----                           -----                                                                                   
PSVersion                      6.0.0-beta                                                                              
PSEdition                      Core                                                                                    
GitCommitId                    v6.0.0-beta.3-148-gcc35c41c235687931837b2e226e6c96ec7870007-dirty                       
OS                             Microsoft Windows 6.1.7601 S                                                            
Platform                       Win32NT                                                                                 
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...}                                                                 
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3                                                                                     
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1                                                                                 
WSManStackVersion              3.0                                                                                     

```

comments.author: mirichmo
comments.body: This might be expected. Did you install a WMF on the Win 7 system? Lots of changes were made to WMI and WinRM between win 7 and win 8.

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body:
Tried Beta.7 on Win7 box with WMF5.1 installed, getting error:

```none
PS C:\> get-ciminstance win32_bios
get-ciminstance : Unable to find an entry point named 'GetCurrentThread' in
DLL 'api-ms-win-core-processthreads-l1-1-2.dll'.
At line:1 char:1
+ get-ciminstance win32_bios
+ ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
    + CategoryInfo          : NotSpecified: (root\cimv2:win32_bios:String) [Ge
   t-CimInstance], EntryPointNotFoundException
    + FullyQualifiedErrorId : CimCmdlet_EntryPointNotFoundException,Microsoft.
   Management.Infrastructure.CimCmdlets.GetCimInstanceCommand
```

title: Get-CimInstace in broken on Windows 7 on PSCore
